tool.name: qiime2 feature-table heatmap
tool.description: Generate a heatmap representation of a feature table

param.name: type
param.label: sample_metadata: MetadataColumn[Categorical]
param.help: [optional] Annotate the sample IDs with these sample metadata values. When metadata is present and `cluster`='feature', samples will be sorted by the metadata values.

validator.message: The first column cannot be selected (they are IDs).

param.name: type
param.label: feature_metadata: MetadataColumn[Categorical]
param.help: [optional] Annotate the feature IDs with these feature metadata values. When metadata is present and `cluster`='sample', features will be sorted by the metadata values.

validator.message: The first column cannot be selected (they are IDs).

param.name: normalize
param.label: normalize: Bool
param.help: [default: Yes] Normalize the feature table by adding a psuedocount of 1 and then taking the log10 of the table.

param.name: metric
param.label: metric: Str % Choices('dice', 'kulsinski', 'euclidean', 'sokalsneath', 'correlation', 'canberra', 'jaccard', 'rogerstanimoto', 'braycurtis', 'seuclidean', 'chebyshev', 'matching', 'sokalmichener', 'cosine', 'cityblock', 'hamming', 'yule', 'mahalanobis', 'minkowski', 'russellrao', 'sqeuclidean')
param.help: [default: 'euclidean'] Metrics exposed by seaborn (see http://seaborn.pydata.org/generated/seaborn.clustermap.html#seaborn.clustermap for more detail).

param.name: method
param.label: method: Str % Choices('complete', 'average', 'median', 'ward', 'weighted', 'single', 'centroid')
param.help: [default: 'average'] Clustering methods exposed by seaborn (see http://seaborn.pydata.org/generated/seaborn.clustermap.html#seaborn.clustermap for more detail).

param.name: color_scheme
param.help: [default: 'rocket'] The matplotlib colorscheme to generate the heatmap with.

tool.help:
QIIME 2: feature-table heatmap ============================== Generate a heatmap representation of a feature table
Outputs: -------- :visualization.qzv: <no description>
|
Description: ------------ Generate a heatmap representation of a feature table with optional clustering on both the sample and feature axes.
Tip: To generate a heatmap containing taxonomic annotations, use `qiime taxa collapse` to collapse the feature table at the desired taxonomic level.
|
